hypothesis_content.title: Low-Volatility Squeeze Breakout with Options Flow Confirmation
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC 10-day realized volatility drops below 30% (placing it in the lowest 20th percentile yearly) and is followed by a 4-hour close outside a 20-period Bollinger Band (2 std dev) WITH concurrent bullish options flow (1-day put/call volume ratio < 0.7), a significant volatility expansion move in the breakout direction is likely.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Low volatility compresses energy, making explosive moves likely. Options flow provides a 'smart money' directional bias, filtering false breakouts. This targets the volatility expansion itself, not just price.
entry_conditions: 4-hour close > 20-period BB upper band OR < 20-period BB lower band
Daily BTC options put/call volume ratio < 0.7 (for long breakout) OR > 1.3 (for short breakout)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Volatility Target: Exit when 10-day realized volatility crosses above 60%.
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price closes back inside the 20-period BB on the 4H.
exit_conditions.time_exit: Exit after 6 days if volatility remains subdued (<40%)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakouts from similar low-volatility compressions that meet options flow criteria fail to trigger a sustained rise in 10-day RV above 50% within one week more than 40% of the time.
